Ok, I have an updated version of Jesse, v.02 at
http://www.cei.net/~dphofrules/glad/Jesse.zip - It's over 2.5
megabytes so be patient.

I think I understand enough to go on with the next phase in thumbnails
-  the advanced thumbnail which will put objects on the map.  I have
got to figure out the size I want to use.  I don't plan on making the
advanced thumbnails flexible in size.

Also, I have some other good news: With a lot of reading and testing
of some addin, I should be able to get Jesse to save the thumbnail
images as . . JPGs.

* * *

Ok, truthfully, I would rather solve an extremely complicated math
problem than write.  This translates into meaning that documentation
might be . . sketchy for a while.

Also, I'm looking into taking text output from a maze generating
program and converting into a scenario map.

* * *

Also, I have this great idea for a scenario that's a cross between
"The Weakest Link" and "The Large Army" from my set.  What?  You don't
know what those maps look like? 
http://www.cei.net/~dphofules/glad/SCEN137.bmp and
http://www.cei.net/~dphofrules/glad/SCEN161.bmp

* * *

You know, whenever the official Gladiator website goes back up, I'll
probably end up putting at least 10 megabytes of stuff on it the 1st
day if I keep this pace up.
